Manx: Arrane mychione eirinee santoylagh ta cur feer veg dy faill da ny labbreeyn ayns yn ouyr:
English: A song about voracious farmers who give very poor wages to the labourers in the autumn:
Diplomatic: Arrane mychione eirrinee Santoylagh ta cur feer veg dy fail da ny labbreeyn ayns yn ouyr

Manx: Ta’n imbagh fouyr er jeet dy jeean,
English: The harvest season has come suddenly
Diplomatic: Ta’n imbagh fouyr er jeet dy jeean

Manx: As ta ny magheryn geayney creen,
English: And the green fields are ripe,
Diplomatic: As ta ny maghryn ghoiney chreen

Manx: Ny labbreeyn ta goit ayns fouyr,
English: The labourers, taken on in autumn
Diplomatic: Ny labbreeyn ta gooit ayns fooar

Manx: Choud’s ta ny berçhee çhaglym troar.
English: Whilst the rich are gathering in produce.
Diplomatic: Chouda ta ny Chouds ta ny berchee chaglym throar

Manx: Ny heirinnee dy gastey shooyl,
English: The farmers walk briskly,
Diplomatic: Ny eirrinnee dy gastey shooyl

Manx: Freayll arrey harroo lesh dagh sooill,
English: Keeping watch over them, all eyes,
Diplomatic: Freeal arrey harroo lesh dagh sooil

Manx: Ny-yeih, s’beg faill t’ad dy chur da.
English: Yet, how little pay they are giving for it.
Diplomatic: Ny-yeih s’beg faill ta’d dy chur da

Manx: Nagh vel goo Yee er shoh gimraa.
English: Hasn’t the Word of God mentioned about this?
Diplomatic: Nagh vel ghoo Yee er shoh gymraa

Manx: Feer veg ta’d cur da’n labbree boght,
English: Very little they give to the poor labourer,
Diplomatic: Feer veg ta’d chur da’n labbree bogh

Manx: Son e hooilleil as labboragh,
English: For his toil and labour,
Diplomatic: Son y hooilleil as labberagh

Manx: Son kiangley arroo ayns yn ouyr,
English: For binding corn in the autumn,
Diplomatic: Son kiangley arroo ayns yn ouyr

Manx: Ny-yeih t’ad geam dy vel eh rouyr.
English: Yet, they shout out that it is too much.
Diplomatic: Ny-yeih ta’d geam dy vel eh rouyr

Manx: Kiarail son berçhys cha vel fea,
English: Caring for wealth, there is no rest.
Diplomatic: Kiarrail son berchys cha vel fea

Manx: Ec lheid yn hooinney ayns y vea,
English: For such a man in life,
Diplomatic: Eck lheid yn dhoinney ayns y vea

Manx: Yn eill ta shymley lesh imnea.
English: The flesh that withers with worry,
Diplomatic: Y eill ta shymley lesh imnea.

Manx: Shen ta mac Syrac shickyr gra.
English: That is what the son of Syrac surely says.
Diplomatic: Shen ta mac Syrac shickker gra

Manx: Ta’n berçhagh goaill er laue tooilleil,
English: The richman takes on a working hand.
Diplomatic: Ta’n berchagh ghoaill er laue tooilleil

Manx: Ta ayns e verçhys cur treishteil,
English: Who trusts in his wealth,
Diplomatic: Ta ayns y verchys cur treishteil

Manx: Cha vod eh goaill lane fea ny shee,
English: He cannot take much rest or peace,
Diplomatic: Cha vod eh ghoaill lane fea ny shee

Manx: Raad ta e hashtey ta e chree.
English: His heart is where his treasure is.
Diplomatic: Raad ta y hashtey ta y chree

Manx: Agh bee nyn mea dy leah ec kione,
English: But our lives will soon be at an end.
Diplomatic: Agh be nyn mea dy lheah eck kione

Manx: Ersooyl myr Adam as e chloan ,
English: Gone, like Adam and his children,
Diplomatic: Ersooyl mor Adam as y chloan

Manx: Shegin da faigail dy chooilley nhee,
English: Everything must be left,
Diplomatic: Shegin da faigail dy chooilley nhee

Manx: Son dy ve briwnysit eck Jee.
English: To be judged by God.
Diplomatic: Son dy ve briwnysit eck Jee

Manx: T’er ghra dy bee Eh feanish geyre,
English: Who has said that he will be a severe witness,
Diplomatic: T’er ghra dy bee Eh feannish gayre

Manx: Noi yn sayntoilagh as molteyr,
English: Against the covetous person and deciever,
Diplomatic: Noi yn sauntooilagh as molteyr

Manx: Ta chonney labbree ayns y aail,
English: Who pressures a labourer in his pay;
Diplomatic: Ta chonney labbree ayns y aail

Manx: Cha vod eh veih jymmoose scapail.
English: He cannot escape from fury.
Diplomatic: Cha vod eh veih jymnooise scapail

Manx: Agh ta yn saynt trooid ooilley roie,
English: But meanness runs through everything,
Diplomatic: Agh ta yn saynt trooid ooilley roie

Manx: Ga dy vel airh whilleen er stroie,
English: Although gold has destroyed so many,
Diplomatic: Gha dy vel airh whillyn er stroie

Manx: Agh fegooish gerjagh, ayns anguaish,
English: But without comfort, in anguish,
Diplomatic: Agh fegoish gerjagh ayns anguaish

Manx: Paardee ad rish ec oor nyn maaish.
English: They will part with it at the hour of their death.
Diplomatic: Paardee ad rish eckoair nyn maaish

Manx: Nyn ghree va soit er cosney airh,
English: Their hearts that were set on earning gold,
Diplomatic: Nyn ghree va soit er chosney airh

Manx: As jannoo reddyn nagh row cair,
English: And doing things that were not just,
Diplomatic: As jannoo reddyn nagh row cair

Manx: Gyn smooinaght er nyn jerrey treih,
English: Without thinking about their miserable ends,
Diplomatic: Gyn smooinaght er nyn jerrey treih

Manx: As yn jymmoose veagh çheet nyn yeih.
English: And the wrath that would be coming after them.
Diplomatic: As yn jymmooiss vagh cheet nyn yeih

Manx: Farquhar
English: Farquhar
Diplomatic: Farquhar
